question: Who can dissolve the Lok Sabha prior to completion of its tenure?
option1: President on recommendation of Council of Ministers
option2: President on recommendation of the Speaker
answer: President on recommendation of Council of Ministers
explanation: According to Article 85(2)(b) of the Constitution of India the Lok Sabha can be dissolved before completion of its tenure. The President has the power to dissolve the Lok Sabha on the recommendation of Council of Ministers.
